definition-item.definition-title: TOOLS OR BENCH DEVICES NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR, FOR FASTENING, CONNECTING, DISENGAGING OR HOLDING

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Vices
Hand vices; Pin vices
Clamps
Pliers; gripping tools with jaws on pivoted limbs
Hand-held gripping tools other than of the pliers type
Work holders, e.g. magnetic work holders, vacuum work holders
Spanners; Wrenches
Screwdrivers
Hand-driven gear-operated wrenches or screwdrivers
Impact wrenches or screwdrivers
Portable power-driven screw or nut setting or loosening tools
Attachments for drilling apparatus for screw or nut setting or loosening
Details of, or accessories for, spanners, wrenches, screwdrivers
Implements for fastening, connecting or tensioning of wire or strip
Hand tools, specially adapted for fitting together or separating parts or objects
whether or not involving some deformation
Portable power-driven joining or separation tools
Hand tools for applying fasteners other than screws, bolts, nuts or nails

section-body.paragraph-text: This subclass is to be understood as covering those hand tools for fastening, connecting, disengaging, or holding which are not provided for in another subclass such as B25C (nailing or stapling tools), B25D (percussive tools like hammers) or in an application class such as B65B (packaging) or B21F (working of wire)

In B25B5/00 are also classified clamps for mechanically clamping work-pieces on machine tool tables, even though they are not hand tools. B25B5/00 takes precedence before B23Q3/06 (Work-clamping means).
In B25B11/00 also tables, like magnetic tables and vacuum tables are classified, even though they are not hand tools.
For more detailed information about the main groups of B25B check the sheets of these main groups.

definition-item.definition-title: Vices (specially adapted for tying flies for angling A01K97/28; specially adapted for machine tools B23Q3/00 {; rope or cable splicing vices D07B7/162})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Vices with sliding jaws
Vices with pivoted jaws
Arrangements for positively actuating jaws
Arrangements for turning or tilting vices
Details of the vices, e.g. jaws of special shape, slideways

section-body.paragraph-text: B25B1/00 deals with vices per se and details of vices. The function and functioning of vices in the context of machine tools as part of the machine tools is classified in B23Q3/066.
Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Vices for tying flies for angling
Rope or cable splicing vices

section-body.paragraph-text: Vices for machine tool tables are classified in B25B1/00 as far as the vice itself or details thereof are concerned. In that case B25B1/00 takes precedence over B23Q3/066.
The function and functioning of vices for machine tools in the context of the machine tool as part of the machine tool is classified in B23Q3/066.

definition-item.definition-title: {around a vertical axis (B25B1/2447 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Jaw being pivotable around an axis to put one of the jaw faces in a position opposite to a second jaw

definition-item.definition-title: {around a horizontal axis (B25B1/2447 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Jaw being pivotable around an axis to put one of the jaw faces in a position opposite to a second jaw

definition-item.definition-title: Clamps (for holding or positioning work for welding, soldering, or cutting by applying heat locally B23K37/04)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Thisgroup covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Combination of clamps
Supporting devices for clamps
Clamps with sliding jaws
Clamps with pivoted jaws
Arrangements for positively actuating jaws
Clamps for work of special profile
Details of the clamps, e.g. jaws, jaw attachments

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Chucks
Clamps for holding or positioning work for welding, soldering, or cutting by applying heat locally
Clamps for turbine blades
Clamping by using adhesive means
Clamping by using a solidifying liquid, e.g. with freezing, setting or hardening means
Gripping heads in robots

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Chucks
Chucks where the gripping means is a deformable sleeve
Means for securing sliding members using a hydraulically controlled membrane in machine tools

section-body.paragraph-text: In B25B5/00 are also classified clamps for mechanically clamping work-pieces on machine tool tables as far as the clamps themselves or details thereof are concerned, even though these clamps are not hand tools. In this case B25B5/00 takes precedence over B23Q3/06 (Work-clamping means).
The function and functioning of clamps in the context of the machine tool as part of the machine tool is classified in B23Q.

definition-item.definition-title: {with fluid drive (B25B5/087, B25B5/122 take precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fluid-driven clamps using cams
Fluid-driven clamps using toggle levers

definition-item.definition-title: Pliers; Other hand-held gripping tools with jaws on pivoted limbs; Details applicable generally to pivoted-limb hand tools (implements for fastening, connecting, or tensioning wire or strip B25B25/00; adapted for other fitting or separating purposes B25B27/00; for marking animals A01K11/00; dentists' forceps A61C3/00; bending wire eyes B21F1/06; hand-held metal-shearing or metal-cutting devices B23D29/00; hand cutting tools B26B; for punching or perforating B26F1/36; devices for securing ends of binding material in bundling machines B65B13/24; specially designed for watch-making or comparable work G04D1/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Pliers construction in general
Jaws
Joints
Pliers involving special transmission means between the handles and the jaws
Locking means for pliers
Adjusting means for the operating arms
Pliers for sealing
Pliers provided with auxiliary tool elements, e.g. cutting edges, nail extractors

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Implements for fastening, connecting, or tentioning wire or strip
Pliers for assambling or disassembling purposes
Pliers for marking animals
Surgical forceps
Dentist forceps
Pliers for bending wire eyes
Hand-held metal-shearing or metal-cutting devices
Hand-held cutting tools
Pliers for punching or perforating
Pliers for securing ends of binding material
Pliers specially designed for watch-making or comparable work
Pliers for removing insulation or armouring from electrical cables

definition-item.definition-title: Locking means {(B25B7/123 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Self-locking toggle lever pliers

definition-item.definition-title: Hand-held gripping tools other than those covered by group B25B7/00 (wrenches B25B13/00; specially adapted for watchmakers' or like use G04D)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Gripping tools with sliding or pivotal connections
Gripping tools without sliding or pivotal connections, e.g. tweezers

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Surgical forceps
Dentist forceps
Gripping heads in robots
Load carriers
Hand-held implements for removing litter
Hand-held implements picking up excrements
Gripping tools specially adapted for watchmakers
Gripping tools for fluorescent lamps
Gripping tools for light bulbs

definition-item.definition-title: Work holders not covered by any preceding group in the subclass, e.g. magnetic work holders, vacuum work holders (for holding or positioning work for welding, soldering, or cutting by applying heat locally B23K37/04; specially adapted to machine tools B23Q3/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Work holders
Magnetic work holders
Vacuum work holders

section-body.paragraph-text: Magnetic means for holding work-pieces on tables of tool machines are partially classified as well in B23Q3/154, B23Q3/1546, B23Q3/1546 as in B25B11/005
Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Holding or positioning work for welding, soldering, or cutting by applying heat locally
Holding work-pieces on machine tool tables by magnetic means
Robot vacuum gripping head
Holding work-pieces by suction in cutting machines
Vacuum material handling devices associated with conveyors
Suction grippers for separating articles from a pile
Load-engaging elements for lifting by magnetic means
Load-engaging elements for lifting by electro-magnetic means
Implements for mounting doors
Portble devices for holding doors
Electromagnets for lifting handling or transport
Holding semiconductors by vacuum

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Signs, plates, panels or boards being secured to a surface by magnetic means

section-body.paragraph-text: In B25B11/00 also tables, like magnetic tables and vacuum tables are classified, even though they are not hand tools.

definition-item.definition-title: Spanners; Wrenches (hand-driven gear-operated B25B17/00; impact wrenches B25B19/00; portable power-driven B25B21/00 {; spanners or wrenches pecially adapted for osteosynthesis A61B17/8875}; machines for fitting together or separating metal parts B23P19/00 {; for mounting or dismounting wheels B60B29/003})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Cross wrenches
Wrenches with rigid jaws
Wrenches with adjustable jaws
Wrenches of the chuck type
Wrenches of the ratchet type, for providing a free return stroke of the handle
Wrenches for special purposes
Wrenches for operating on work of special profile, e.g. pipes
Chain or strap wrenches
Spanner sets
Jaw attachments

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Wrenches or spanners specially adapted for osteosynthesis
Spanners and wrenches for mounting and dismounting wheels
Devices for removing threaded caps of containers
Tools for removing threaded caps from containers by use of a flexible loop gripping the cap
Wrenches in earth drilling

definition-item.definition-title: with rigid jaws (B25B13/46, B25B13/48 take precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Ratchet wrenches
Wrenches or sockets for special purposes

definition-item.definition-title: with adjustable jaws (B25B13/46, B25B13/48 {B25B13/5041} take precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Ratchet wrenches
Spanners or wrenches for special purposes
Wrenches for pipes with adjustable jaws

definition-item.definition-title: {for operating on pipes or cylindrical objects (B25B13/52 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Chain or strap wrenches

definition-item.definition-title: Internal grip wrenches {(B25B13/5083 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Spanners and wrenches for internally gripping pipes

definition-item.definition-title: Screwdrivers (hand-driven gear-operated B25B17/00; impact screwdrivers B25B19/00; portable power-driven B25B21/00 {; screwdrivers specially adapted for osteosynthesis A61B17/8875})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Screwdrivers characterised by material or shape of the tool bit
Screwdrivers operated by rotating the handle
Screwdrivers operated by axial movement of the handle

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Screwdrivers specially adapted for osteosynthesis
Screwdrivers specially adapted for watchmakers

definition-item.definition-title: Hand-driven gear-operated wrenches or screwdrivers (ratchet-operated B25B13/46 {B25B13/467}, B25B15/04; {for mounting or dismounting wheels B60B29/005})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Hand-driven gear-operated wrenches or screwdrivers
Hand-driven gear-operated wrenches or screwdrivers providing for torque amplification

table-column.paragraph-text: Gear-operated ratchet wrenches
Ratchet screwdrivers

definition-item.definition-title: providing for torque amplification

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Wrenches with torque amplification for mounting or dismounting wheels

definition-item.definition-title: Impact wrenches or screwdrivers (portable power-driven B25B21/02)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Impact wrenches and screwdrivers that are not power-driven

definition-item.definition-title: Portable power-driven screw or nut setting or loosening tools; (details or components, e.g. casings, bodies, of portable power-driven tools not particularly related to the operation performed B25F5/00; {for mounting or dismounting wheels B60B29/006}); Attachments for drilling apparatus serving the same purpose (machines B23P19/06)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Portable power-driven screw or nut setting or loosening tools
Power-driven screw or nut setting or loosening tools for combined nut setting and crimping
Power-driven screw or nut setting or loosening tools for special purposes
power-driven screw or nut setting or loosening tools of the ratchet type
Attachments for drilling apparatus for screw or nut setting or loosening
Power-driven screw or nut setting or loosening tools with automatic change-over from high speed-low torque mode to low speed-high torque mode
Power-driven screw or nut setting or loosening tools with means for imparting impact to screwdriver blade or nut socket

section-body.paragraph-text: Details or components, e.g. casings, bodies, of portable power-driven tools not particularly related to the operation performed are classified in B25F5/00
Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Multi-spindle power-driven screw or nut setting or loosening
Power-operated devices for mounting or dismounting wheels
Power-operated devices for removing threaded caps of containers
Powered wrenches in earth drilling

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Screw or nut setting or loosening machines
Details or components, e.g. casings, bodies, of portable power-driven tools not particularly related to the operation performed

definition-item.definition-title: Details of, or accessories for, spanners, wrenches, screwdrivers (bolt tensioners B25B29/02)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Connections or joints between tool parts
Screw guiding means
Socket or nut ejector means
Means for adjusting screwing depth
Abutment for screws or nuts
Reaction arms
Counter holding devices
Tools for placing nut or screw lock wires
Arrangements for handling screws or nuts
Arrangement of torque limiters or torque indicators in wrenches or screwdrivers
Handles
Devices for illuminating the head of the screw or the nut

section-body.paragraph-text: Details or components, e.g. casings, bodies, of portable power-driven tools not particularly related to the operation performed are classified in B25F5/00. Even though there is a group B25B23/16 for handles, details of handles for hand-driven screwdrivers and wrenches are classified in B25G1/00 and details of handles for power-driven screwdrivers and wrenches are classified in B25F5/02. Angular adjustment means between tool head and handle of a hand-driven fastening tool are classified in B25B23/0028 as well as in B25G1/063
Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Details of handles of power-driven screwdrivers and wrenches
Details of handles of hand-driven screwdrivers and wrenches
Device for determining value of torque or twisting moment for tightening a nut or screw per se, when not in connection with the fastening process itself

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Feeding or holding elements like screws or nuts in machines
Screw or nut setting or loosening machines
Torque limiting in screw or nut setting or loosening machines
Arrangements in machine tools for improving direct observation of the working space, e.g. using mirrors or lamps
Nail feeding devices for belts of nails
Details or components, e.g. casings, bodies, of portable power-driven tools not particularly related to the operation performed
Torque reaction bars for portable rotary tools other than fastening tools
Nails formed in integral series using disposable strips or discs per se
Bolts, screws, or nuts formed in integral series using disposable strips or discs per se
Breaking-bolts per se
Lightening devices for hand tools in general

definition-item.definition-title: using built-in magazine (B25B23/045 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Feeding screws or nuts using disposable strips or discs carrying the screws or nuts

definition-item.definition-title: {for hand-driven screw-drivers (B25B23/105 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Gripping device for the fastening element, where the gripping device is an integral part of the driving element

definition-item.definition-title: {by electrical means}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Tightening of fasteners, wherein the torque is measured electrically, e.g. using ultrasound or strain gauge.

definition-item.definition-title: Implements for fastening, connecting or tensioning of wire or strip

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Implements for tensioning of wire or strip
Implements for applying wire clasps to hose couplings

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Tools for placing nut or screw lock wires
Turnbuckles and the like

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Bundling articles

definition-item.definition-title: Hand tools, specially adapted for fitting together or separating parts or objects whether or not involving some deformation, not otherwise provided for (machines for simply fitting together or separating metal parts or objects B23P19/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Hand tools adapted for fitting together or separating parts or objects
Tools for fixing internally screw-threaded tubular fasteners
Tools for bonding or debonding brake linings
Tools for removing or installing seals
Hand tools specially adapted for fitting together or separating parts of motor-vehicles
Hand tools specially adapted for fitting together or separating parts of bicycles
Tools for wheel weights
Explosive-powered hand tools
Tools moving along strips, e.g. decorating or sealing strips, to insert them in, or remove them from, grooves or profiles
Tools for connecting objects by press fit or detaching same
Tools for assembling objects other than by press fit or detaching same

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Tools or implements for repairing chains using metal-working operations
Wrenches for mounting or dismounting wheels
Mounting or dismounting tyre valves
Spring positioning or withdrawing for watchmakers or watch-repairers

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Machines for assembling or disassembling
Machines moving along strips, e.g. decorating or sealing strips, to insert them in, or remove them from, grooves or profiles
Machines for installing or removing seals, e.g. O-rings
Hammers having the impacting head in the form of a sleeve slidable on a shaft
Coil spring compressors
Assembling sealing arrangements with vehicle parts
Assembly, disassembly, repair or servicing of endless-track systems
Hand-held apparatus for delivering pressure-sensitive adhesive tape
Implements for finishing work on buildings, e.g. devices for fitting sealing strips or other finishing strips
Equipment for mounting belts, ropes or chains
Accessories for bringing two tubular members closer to each other
Auxiliary devices for flanged joints
Hand tools for crimping electric connectors

definition-item.definition-title: {Tools for removing or installing seals (B25B27/0092 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Tools moving along strips, e.g. decorating or sealing strips, to insert them in, or remove them from, grooves or profiles

definition-item.definition-title: Accessories (specially for spanners, wrenches, screwdrivers B25B23/00; tool boxes, tool positioning stands B25H)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Accessories
Bolt tensioners

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Bolt tensioners in machines
Screwed prestressed connection by means of liquid, grease, rubber, where the tensile strength is produced in the connection itself and not by a tool

definition-item.definition-title: Hand tools for applying fasteners (nailing or stapling tools B25C)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Hand tools for applying fasteners other than screws, bolts, nuts or nails
Hand tools for applying dowels
Hand tools for temporarily connecting sheets before or during assembly operations

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Attachments or adapters for portable power-driven percussive tools for placing dowels

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Attachments or adapters for portable power-driven percussive tools for placing dowels
Devices for applying fasteners, e.g. clips, to bundles of sheets

definition-item.definition-title: Hand tools not covered by any other group in this subclass

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Hand tools not covered by any other group
Chuck keys
